name: Low Pass Filter
description: an audio signal filter that muffles the signal amplitude after the cut-off frequency

args.name: Pivotal frequency
args.description: Frequency that is representing edge before/after which, filter will be used

name: High Pass Filter
description: an audio signal filter that muffles the signal amplitude to the cut-off frequency

args.name: Pivotal frequency
args.description: Frequency that is representing edge before/after which, filter will be used

name: Band Pass Filter
description: an audio signal filter that muffles the signal amplitude before and after the first and after the second cutoff frequency

args.name: Outer-Pivotal frequency left
args.description: Frequency that is representing edge before which, filter will be used

args.name: Outer-Pivotal frequency right
args.description: Frequency that is representing edge after which, filter will be used

name: Notch Filter
description: an audio signal filter that mutes the amplitude of a given frequency signal almost entirely

args.name: Inner-Pivotal frequency left
args.description: Frequency that is representing edge after which, filter will be used

args.name: Inner-Pivotal frequency right
args.description: Frequency that is representing edge before which, filter will be used

name: Gain/Volume
description: Change amplitude of all non zero frequencies on some amount of decibels

args.name: Level
args.description: Increase in decibels (0dB means nothing will be changed)

name: Master/Level
description: Apply percents on amplitudes on all frequencies

args.name: Level
args.description: Percent of change (100% means nothing will be changed)

name: Noise filtering
description: Separates signal into signal and noise section, than reduce noise value for selected amount of dB

name: Useful signal amplification
description: Separates signal into signal and noise section, than increases signal value for selected amount of dB

args.name: Level
args.description: Increment in decibels (0 dB means nothing will be changed, default value = +3 dB)

name: Select/trim time interval
description: Selected interval is to be left

args.name: Start time
args.description: Start time of trimming/selecting, left part from start time is to be deleted

args.name: End time
args.description: End time of trimming/selecting, right part from end time is to be deleted

name: 3D Signal diagram
description: Projection of three-dimensional space onto a two-dimensional plane, where the third coordinate axis is represented by a color change

args.name: x-axis
args.description: Characteristics that is been represented by x-axis

args.name: y-axis
args.description: Characteristics that is been represented by y-axis

args.name: z-axis
args.description: Characteristics that is been represented by z-axis

name: 2D Signal diagram
description: Graph with two axes with corresponding data

args.name: x-axis
args.description: Characteristics that is been represented by x-axis

args.name: y-axis
args.description: Characteristics that is been represented by y-axis

name: Copy/Branch
description: Makes n-amount copies of selected track

args.name: Amount of copies
args.description: Amount of copies of tracks (1 copy means that amount of tracks won't change)
